亞洲20大富豪家族中，7大來自東南亞掌握著近4成資產
05 Nov 2019, 12:37 by 新加坡紅螞蟻


我們想讓你知道的是《彭博》的亞洲20大富豪家族掌握著超過450億美元的資產。而來自泰國、新加坡、印尼與菲律賓的7個家族，則是貢獻了近4成。而且這些家族都是華裔，全部來自中國東南沿海省份。



文：葉安琪
富得過三代
俗話說「創業容易守業難」，平常在生活中也聽過不少關於「富不過三代」的真實故事。
先輩辛苦打拼下來的江山，當傳到後輩的手裡時該如何延續又是一大難題。不過，以下介紹的富豪家族則是充分體現了後輩如何將祖上留下來的財富更進一步地善用並將家族事業推向更高峰。
日前，《彭博社》公佈了亞洲20大富豪家族排行榜，前三位富豪家族分別來自印度、香港和泰國。在這20大有錢家族中，來自新加坡的僅有豐隆集團的郭氏家族和遠東機構的黃氏家族上榜。以地區計算，最多入榜的富豪家族來自香港，一共有6個家族。
我們先來看看入選這個排行榜的幾個條件：

淨值截止於2019年7月19日；
家族必須要有亞洲血統；
排除第一代的資產家和單一繼承者；
家族的財富來源不得太散或不透明。

據《彭博社》報導，排行榜不包括第一代富豪和家族財富由單一繼承者掌控的家族，因此榜中沒有出現任何中國大陸富豪的蹤影。話雖如此，但榜中多數的家族都有著華裔血統。
讓我們看看這20大富豪家族究竟有誰吧。
1.安巴尼家族（Ambani）


信實工業集團董事長穆克什·安巴尼（Mukesh Ambani）Photo Credit：Reuters/達志影像

身家：504億美元（693億新元）
地點：印度
公司：信實工業集團（Reliance Industries)
安巴尼家族掌管著印度最大的私營公司、在財富500（Forbes 500）強中排名106的信實工業集團。
德魯拜・安巴尼（Dhirubhai Ambani）于1957年創立了印度信實集團。他在2002年去世時沒有留下任何關於遺產分配的遺囑。在2005年，通過母親的協商，長子穆可什・安巴尼（Mukesh Ambani）和次子阿尼爾・安巴尼（Anil Ambani）達成協議，將公司拆分。
穆可什・安巴尼接管石油、天然氣、石化產品和煉油的業務，阿尼爾・安巴尼則是接管了建築、電信、資產管理、娛樂和發電的業務。
根據《福布斯》的資料，信實工業集團的最大股東兼董事長穆克什・安巴尼目前淨資產為509億美元（700億新元），在2019年《億萬富翁榜》（Billionaires List）中排在全球第13位。此外，他也在去年成功取代阿里巴巴集團創始人馬雲，成為亞洲首富。
安巴尼在印度孟買的全球最貴豪宅之一的「安蒂拉」（Antilla）於2010年完工。這座27層樓高的豪宅裡面建有3個直升機停機坪、6層樓的停車場和一系列的空中花園。


安巴尼在印度孟買的全球最貴豪宅之一的「安蒂拉」（Antilla）Photo Credit：Reuters/達志影像

2.郭氏家族（Kwok）
身家：380億美元（523億新元）
地點：香港
公司：新鴻基地產（Sun Hung Kai Properties)
上市于1972年，郭得勝創立的新鴻基地產是香港最大的房地產開發商之一。自他在1990年離世後，他的三名兒子，郭炳湘，郭炳江和郭炳聯接管了這個龐大的家族事業。
在1997年，郭氏家族在香港的財雄勢大讓長子郭炳湘被罪犯盯上。當時正獨自駕車回家的他被綽號「大富豪」的罪犯張子強綁架。他的家人最終在大約1個星期後，支付了6億港元（1億新元）贖金才將他贖回。這名新鴻基地產前主席在去年因中風病逝，享年68歲。
他的二弟郭炳江因捲入貪污案而入獄，目前正在服刑。
如今由三弟郭炳聯出任新鴻基地產主席兼總經理。


郭炳聯（左）與郭炳江（中）Photo Credit：Reuters/達志影像

3.謝氏家族（Chearavanont）
身家：379億美元（521億新元）
地點：泰國
公司：正大國際集團（Charoen Pokphand Group)
正大集團是世界最大的動物飼料和牲畜生產商之一。這個家族企業可追溯到1921年，當時的謝易初（Chia Ek Chor）逃離了他在中國南方遭受颱風襲擊的村莊，並和他的兄弟到泰國開始販賣起從中國運進的蔬菜種子給泰國當地農夫。
在時隔將近一個世紀的如今，正大集團已成為中國國家主席習近平的關鍵經濟盟友。
謝易初最小的兒子謝國民（Dhanin Chearavanont）擔任了正大集團48年的主席兼董事長，他在2017年卸任但他仍保留了資深主席的身份。（編按：謝國民甫於2019年4月24日辭任正大集團旗下上市公司、同時也是最主要事業集團——正大食品集團的董事長。）
如今，正大集團主席的位子由謝國民的長子謝吉人（Soopakij Chearavanont）出任，而幼子謝鎔仁（Suphachai Chearavanont）則是該集團的執行長。


正大集團資深董事長謝國民（中）Photo Credit: 中央社

4.黃氏家族 （Hartono）
身家：325億美元（447億新元）
地點：印尼
公司：針記集團（Djarum)，印尼中亞銀行（Bank Central Asia）
黃惠忠與哥哥黃惠祥從父親黃維源手中繼承了香煙製造商針記集團。他們父親去世後，就將資產投資進印尼最大的私營銀行，印尼中亞銀行。他們目前是印尼中亞銀行的最大股東。
黃惠忠的兒子Armand Wahyudi Hartono自2016年起擔任中亞銀行的董事副總經理。
補充：雖然新加坡歌手向陽(Nathan Hartono) 和黃氏家族有著同樣的 「Hartono」姓氏，但是別誤會，他們之間沒有關係哦。


印尼富豪黄惠忠Photo Credit：Reuters/達志影像

5. 李氏家族（Lee）
身家：285億美元（392億新元）
地點：南韓
公司：三星集團（Samsung）
看到這個集團名字，應該不陌生吧？就算沒用過他家產品但總該聽過吧，如果沒有那你很有可能是住在山洞裡的了。
1938年，李秉喆（Lee Byung-chul）成立的三星原是一家出口蔬果和魚的貿易公司。後來他在1969年成立了三星電子，也就是後來成為全球最大的存儲晶片和智慧手機製造商。
1987年，老三李健熙（Lee Kun-hee）在他父親離世後接手三星電子企業。可他之後在2014年因心臟病發而無法工作。此後，三星便由他的兒子李在鎔（Lee Jae-yong）繼續領導。


左為李在鎔，右為李健熙Photo Credit: Reuters/達志影像

6.許氏家族 （Yoovidhya）
身家：245億美元（337億新元）
地點：泰國
公司：TCP集團（TCP Group）
紅牛，這個能量飲料牌子相信蟻粉都有聽過甚至喝過吧？不說你可能還不知道，光是在2018年就有68億罐紅牛被售出呢！這個廣受世界各地人士喜愛的能量飲料就是TCP集團的創始人許書標（Chaleo Yoovidhya）發明的。
回溯60年前，他先是擔任了藥品銷售員，之後在1956年成立了天絲醫藥有限合夥企業 (T.C. Pharmaceutical Limited Partnership) ，並自行研製藥品配方。
在那之後，他看准了飲料的商機，便著手研製發明能量飲料配方，也就是如今眾所皆知的紅牛（Kratingdaeng）飲料。後來，許書標先生認識了有意把「紅牛」產品引入歐洲市場的奧地利商人，迪特裡希・馬特希茨（Dietrich Mateschitz）。因此他與許書標先生合資在奧地利設立了「Red Bull GmbH（紅牛有限公司）」把紅牛飲料出口到全球70個國家。
2012年，許書標離世，TCP集團便由他的兒子許馨雄（Saravoot Yoovidhya）接手擔任首席執行官。


TCP 集團的創始人許書標（Chaleo Yoovidhya）Photo Credit：AP/達志影像

7.米斯垂家族（Mistry）
身家：211億美元（290億新元）
地點：印度
公司：Shapoorji Pallonji Group
米斯垂的家族企業起源於Pallonji Mistry和一名英國人在1865年的一場建築交易。這個擁有超過150年歷史的建築巨頭Shapoorji Pallonji集團在當時被取名為Littlewood Pallonji＆Co。1881年，該集團在孟買市的馬拉巴爾山（Malabar Hill）上建造一個蓄水池為孟買居民提供水。
他的兒子Shapoorji輟學後就在家族企業中工作，他過後繼續收購Tata Sons的少數股權。Tata Sons是現時市值達1000億美元的Tata Group背後的控股公司。
與祖父同名的第三代繼承人Pallonji在18歲時加入建築行業，而後來他在職業生涯中也成功簽下許多盈利豐富的合約。最值得注意的其中一單案子便是他在馬斯喀特建立的阿曼蘇丹皇宮。他在2012年將公司領導權交給他的兒子Shapoor。


Shapoor的弟弟Pallonji Mistry在2012年接任塔塔集團主席，2016年卸任。Photo Credit：Newscom/ 達志影像

8.施氏家族 （SY）
身家：209億美元（287億新元）
地點：菲律賓
公司：SM控股集團 （SM Investments Corporation）
施至成1924年出生于福建廈門，12歲時到菲律賓投靠父親，在父親的雜貨店中幫工。
施家的雜貨店在第二次世界大戰後慘遭摧毀，但是施至成並沒有選擇跟隨父親返回中國。他在馬尼拉一所大學考取商科學位之後，自己開了一家販賣美國士兵帶進當地的鞋子。
當他的鞋店開到第六間後，他因為供應商無法提高供應量從而決定將生意多元化，開始販賣起服裝和軟貨。看準了商機，施至成將一站式購物概念帶入菲律賓。1972年，他創立了菲律賓的第一家SM百貨商店。1985年，面積達42萬4000平方米（編按：12.8萬坪）的第一座SM超級商場正式運營。至今，SM購物商場在菲律賓已經有超過70座，而SM控股集團也將商業板塊擴展至酒店業、銀行業和房地產業。
連續11年蟬聯菲律賓首富的施至成育有6名子女。他在兩年前卸下SM控股集團主席之位後，其業務便交由子女和得力助手接手打點。
今年1月，他在睡夢中離世，享壽94歲。


SM控股集團創辦人施至成Photo Credit：Reuters/ 達志影像

9.鄭氏家族 （Chirathivat）
身家：203億美元（279億新元）
地點：泰國
公司：中央集團（Central Group）
中央集團，如今的泰國零售大王，源于70多年前的一間雜貨店。
和泰國許多其他家族企業相同，鄭氏家族是一家祖籍在中國的泰裔華人。創始人鄭心平（Tiang Chirathivat）為了謀生，在1925年從海南往南遷至泰國。他在岳父的餐館中打了將近20年的工才借錢開間自己的雜貨店。
不同於其他選擇在當地唐人街開店的華裔移民，他將店鋪開在曼谷郊區。由於靠近一座皇家打造的大寺廟，所以他也就開始販賣起點心和為公眾提供駁船服務。兩年後，他搬至河的對岸，在曼谷文華東方酒店附近和長子鄭有華（Samrit）和合開了間新的店面。9年後，鄭氏一家開設了唐人街中的第一家百貨公司。
如今中央集團的董事長鄭昌（Tos Chirathivat) 是鄭氏家族企業的第三代傳人。1993年他成立了泰國的第一家超級購物中心「Big C Supercenter」，滿足了大量中低收入水準的人群的需求，取得巨大成功，之後更在3年內迅速擴張到20家店鋪。
現在，中央集團擁有50多家子公司，是泰國最大的私人商業集團之一。同時，該集團也和中國京東專攻電子商務的合資公司。


鄭氏家族企業的第三代傳人鄭昌（Tos Chirathivat)Photo Credit：Reuters/ 達志影像

10.嘉道理家族 （Kadoorie）
身家：185億美元（254億新元）
地點：香港
公司：中電控股（CLP Holdings）
嘉道理旗下的中電控股是香港最大的電力生產商，為香港80％的人口供電。
1880年代期間，身為伊拉克猶太人的兩兄弟埃利・嘉道理（Elly Kadoorie）和艾理斯・嘉道理（Ellis Kadoorie）抵達香港為沙遜家庭（另一個顯赫的猶太家族）打工。兩兄弟後來開始紮根香港，設立中華電力有限公司。1903年，公司的首座發電廠正式投入服務。
除此之外，嘉道理兄弟也開始進軍酒店業。他們在1890年入股香港上海大酒店有限公司，旗下的半島酒店品牌管理著世界各地多家豪華酒店。
如今，這兩個集團都是由埃利・嘉道理的孫子，米高・嘉道理（Michael Kadoorie）擔任主席之位。


Michael Kadoorie（左）與勞斯萊斯執行長Ian Robertson（右）Photo Credit：AP/ 達志影像

11.郭氏家族 （Kwek／Quek）
身家：184億美元（253億新元）
地點：新加坡／馬來西亞
公司：豐隆金融集團 Hong Leong Group
郭氏家族有超過15各成員掌控豐隆金融集團業務，所掌控的業務覆蓋房地產行業至金融業。郭氏家族的財富可追溯到1941年，已故的郭芳楓在當年和三個兄弟一起在美芝路上創辦一家名為「豐隆」的小店，專做五金生意。
再往後的幾十年裡，他利用對時局的靈敏嗅覺對地產進行大量投資，終於在70年代末再次看準時機，果斷創辦了豐隆金融有限公司。
1995年，郭芳楓去世。時年54歲的郭令明，成為郭氏家族的第二代掌門人。馬來西亞豐隆集團則是由郭令明的堂弟郭令燦擔任執行主席。


郭氏家族的第二代掌門人郭令明Photo Credit：AP/ 達志影像

12.鄭氏家族（Cheng）
身家：182億美元（250億新元）
地點：香港
公司：周大福集團（Chow Tai Fook）
周大福這個可在各大商場看見的珠寶品牌，就是由鄭氏家族掌管著。或許你會好奇，為何周大福背後的掌管家族姓鄭而不是周呢？其實，周大福的創始人確實是姓周，他正是鄭氏家族創始人鄭裕彤的岳父。
鄭裕彤祖籍廣東順德，13歲因逃避戰亂，在他的父親的安排下到澳門投靠父親的好友、當時經營周大福金鋪的周至遠。鄭裕彤良好的表現很快就獲得周志遠的賞識，並把女兒周翠英許配給他。從此，他協助岳父打理金浦業務，並在1946年被岳父委派到香港開設分行。
1956年，鄭裕彤在岳父離世後繼承了周大福。在他的掌管期間，他首創的「999.9純金」更是讓周大福名聲大噪。過後，他又從黃金轉戰鑽石，將自家品牌的珠寶首飾帶向國際。除了珠寶生意之外，該集團也涉獵如房地產業和百貨公司等業務。
2012年，鄭裕彤2012年2月退任董事會主席，公司由兒子鄭家純接手。


周大福集團前掌門人鄭裕彤（中）Photo Credit：Reuters/ 達志影像

13.黃氏家族（Ng）
身家：172億美元（236億新元）
地點：新加坡
公司：遠東機構（Far East Organization）
黃廷芳在1934年和家人從中國移居來新加坡，並在父母的醬油工廠打工。令人驚訝的是，他不但沒有選擇延續家族生意，反而是踏入地產業並在1960年建立起遠東機構。
遠東機構連同其位於香港的姊妹公司信和集團，是亞洲最大的房地產集團之一。集團旗下有公開上市、私人發展以及投資公司，經營範圍遍及新加坡、馬來西亞、澳大利亞、中國香港及中國。
如今，遠東機構由他兩位蟬聯我國首富的兒子黃志祥和黃志達接管。他的長子黃志祥負責香港方面的營運，而新加坡方面的業務則是由幼子黃志達負責看管。
2017年，黃志祥的長子被指派為信和集團、尖沙咀置業集團有限公司及信和酒店集團的副主席。


信和置業有限公司董事長黃志祥參加土地拍賣會。攝於2007年5月8日。Photo Credit：Reuters/ 達志影像

14.包氏家族（Pao）
身家：167億美元（229億新元）
地點：香港
公司：BW Group、會德豐（BW Group, Wheelock）
被譽為世界船王的包玉剛在1949年從中國移居香港，1955年涉足航運業。當時33歲的他用從上海帶到香港的20千港幣買下第一艘船，開啟他的航海事業。從他購下的第一艘船開始，過了20多年後，該公司已經將旗下船隻數量曾加至超過200艘。
為了適應經濟局勢，包玉剛將從船業得來的盈利投資進房地產。包氏家族中一部分可觀的財富便是來源於香港房地產開發商會德豐集團。
包玉剛掌管的生意在他離世後被分配在他的4個女兒之中。
2014年，包玉剛的外孫吳宗權正式接管會德豐集團。
15.蔡氏家族（Tsai）
身家：162億美元（223億新元）
地點：臺灣
公司：國泰金控，富邦金控（Cathay Financial, Fubon Financial）
蔡家三兄弟蔡萬春，蔡萬霖和蔡萬才在1962年成立國泰險壽，後又在1979年決定分家。結果，蔡萬春得到國泰信託，蔡萬霖拿下國泰險壽，蔡萬才取得國泰產物保險。
蔡萬才父子三人一起將已改名為富邦金控的國泰產險建立起來，成為臺灣橫跨金融、電信、媒體等不同業務板塊的大集團。
蔡萬才過世後，富邦集團由蔡明忠和蔡明興兩兄弟繼續共同努力負責。2016年，兩兄弟互換事業板塊。蔡明忠辭任富邦金控董事長，出任臺灣大哥大董事長。弟弟蔡明興則是擔任富邦金控董事長並兼任富邦人壽董事長。
今年，蔡明興之子蔡承儒正式進入臺灣大哥大董事會。


台灣大哥大董事長蔡明忠Photo Credit: 中央社

16.辛杜佳家族 （Hinduja）
身家：160億美元（220億新元）
地點：印度
公司：辛杜佳集團（Hinduja Group）
「兄弟齊心，齊力斷金」用在辛杜佳家族身上就再合適不過了。辛杜佳集團這個總部位於倫敦的印度裔工業巨頭，其背後的掌控者是辛杜佳家族的四兄弟，Srichand，Gopichand，Prakash 和 Ashok。
曾經的辛杜佳集團是以商人銀行和貿易為主要業務。自從四兄弟從他們的父親Parmanand Deepchand Hinduja手上接管辛杜佳集團後，其集團的業務就開始擴張至汽車工業、資訊技術、地產等多個不同的商業領域。辛杜佳集團也於1979年將總部從伊朗遷至歐洲。
四兄弟在倫敦擁有價值連城的地產業，其中包括他們的房子卡爾頓府聯排（Carlton House Terrace）和白廳內的舊戰爭辦公室（Old War Office building)。


Srichand HindujaPhoto Credit：AP/ 達志影像

17.何氏家族（Ho）
身家：149億美元（204億新元）
地點：香港
公司：澳博控股（SJM）
有澳門「賭王」之稱的何鴻燊與幾名生意夥伴獲得了首個在澳門合法開設賭場的准證，並于1962年建立了澳門的第一座賭場。何氏家族掌管著奧博控股，連同旗下多個賭場和飯店如有五星級榮譽的新葡京酒店。
現年98歲的何鴻燊與4位太太一共孕育了17名子女。他的家產被分配在他的眾多子女中。
目前，他的第四任太太梁安琪是澳博控股的聯席主席。


美高梅中國主席、澳門賭王何鴻燊女兒何超瓊（淨資產68億美元）Photo Credit: AP/達志影像

18.佐治、鳥井家族（Saji／Tori）
身家：148億美元（203億新元）
地點：日本
公司：三得利株式會社（Suntory）
三得利創始人鳥井信治郎（Shinjiro Torii）於1899年開設了第一家店面，售賣果酒和洋酒。後在他兒子佐治信忠（Keizo Saji）的領導下，三得利公司已發展成一個規模龐大的集團，涉足範圍從酒精飲料橫跨到健康食品和健身俱樂部等其它領域。
如今，公司董事長是由創始人之孫佐治信忠（Nobutada Saji）出任。


三得利代表取締役會長佐治信忠（左）與三得利執行長新浪剛史（右）Photo Credit：Reuters/ 達志影像

19.李氏家族（Lee）
身家：147億美元（202億新元）
地點：香港
公司：李錦記集團 （Lee Kum Kee）
或許，你家的冰箱就存放著他家販賣著的超過200種醬料和調味品之一。
創辦人李錦裳在1888年，因為一次在煮蠔湯時忘了顧火，而誤打誤撞發明出了蠔油。就這樣，李錦記這個醬料王國的故事被拉開序幕，傳承了128年並養活了李氏家族的五代人。
最早的蠔油工廠在1902年被大火吞噬之後，李錦記的工廠在澳門進行重建，並在那裡運作至1932年才將總部遷至香港。搬遷之後，李錦記集團的業務中心也從最初的調位醬料，擴展到房地產、餐飲、健康食品和運輸等其它行業。
李氏家族的資產裡含有大量的房地產，其中包括了倫敦的 「對講機」 大廈。
如今的李錦記集團是由第三代李氏後人李文達擔任主席。


圖為李文達長子李惠民，目前擔任李錦記有限公司董事。Photo Credit：AP/ 達志影像

20.鄭氏家族（Chung）
身家：135億美元（185億新元）
地點：南韓
公司：現代集團（Hyundai）
1915年，排行老大的鄭周永（Chung Ju-yung）出身在朝鮮江原道的一個貧苦的農民家庭中。
他過後在1940年集資開了一家汽車修配廠，並在經營工廠的時候學會了汽車原理和發動機的構造知識。六年後，他建立了現代自動車工業社也就是現代汽車集團的前身，並因為豐富的修車經驗和好技術吸引到大量客戶，從而在短時間內就將工廠規模擴大到一百多人。
自1968年起，鄭周永開始設立其它子公司，形成集團制。到90年代，現代集團已擁有80多家子公司，業務從汽車橫跨至建築、造船、娛樂等數個行業。
2001年，在他過世後不久，他其中兩名兒子帶頭爭奪家族產業。最終，作為世界最大汽車製造商之一的現代汽車被鄭周永的二兒子鄭夢九（Chung Mong-koo）奪得掌管權。
2018年，鄭夢九的獨子鄭義宣（Chung Eui-Sun）擔任現代汽車執行副主席之位。


現代集團創辦人鄭周永Photo Credit：AP/ 達志影像

text:
Among the top 20 wealthy families in Asia, 7 out of Southeast Asia hold nearly 40% of assets.
05 Nov 2019, 12:37 by Singapore Red Ants


What we want you to know is that Bloomberg’s 20 richest families in Asia hold more than $45 billion in assets. The seven families from Thailand, Singapore, Indonesia and the Philippines contributed nearly 40%. Moreover, these families are Chinese, all from the coastal provinces of southeast China.



Text: Ye Anqi
Rich for three generations
As the saying goes, "Entrepreneurship is easy to keep business." In life, I have heard a lot of true stories about "rich three generations."
It is a big problem for the ancestors to work hard to break down the rivers and mountains when they reach the hands of the younger generation. However, the rich family described below fully demonstrates how the younger generation will make better use of the wealth left by the ancestors and push the family business to a higher level.
A few days ago, "Bloomberg" announced the list of the top 20 richest families in Asia. The top three rich families came from India, Hong Kong and Thailand. Among the 20 wealthy families, only the Kwok family of the Hong Leong Group and the Huang family of the Far East institutions from Singapore are on the list. In terms of regions, the richest family members from Hong Kong are from Hong Kong, with a total of six families.
Let's first take a look at a few conditions for inclusion in this ranking:

The net value is as of July 19, 2019;
The family must have Asian descent;
Exclude the first generation of asset owners and single successors;
The source of wealth of the family must not be too scattered or opaque.

According to Bloomberg, the rankings do not include the first generation of rich and family wealth controlled by a single successor, so there is no trace of the richest people in mainland China. Having said that, most of the families on the list have Chinese descent.
Let us see who the 20 richest families have.
1. Ambani family (Ambani)


Mukesh Ambani, Chairman of Reliance Industries Group Photo Credit: Reuters/Dazhi Image

Net worth: 50.4 billion US dollars (69.3 billion Singapore dollars)
Location: India
Company: Reliance Industries
The Ambani family is in charge of India's largest private company, Reliance Industries Group, ranked 106th in the Fortune 500.
Dhirubhai Ambani founded the Indian Reliance Group in 1957. He died in 2002 without leaving any wills on the distribution of inheritance. In 2005, through the mother's consultation, the eldest son, Mukesh Ambani, and the second son, Anil Ambani, reached an agreement to split the company.
Mukesh Ambani took over the oil, gas, petrochemicals and refining operations, and Anil Ambani took over the construction, telecommunications, asset management, entertainment and power generation businesses.
According to Forbes, Mukesh Ambani, the largest shareholder and chairman of the Reliance Industries Group, currently has a net asset of $50.9 billion ($70 billion) in the 2019 Billionaires List. It ranks 13th in the world. In addition, he also successfully replaced Ma Yun, the founder of Alibaba Group, as the richest man in Asia last year.
Antani, one of the world's most expensive luxury homes in Mumbai, India, was completed in 2010. The 27-story mansion houses three helipads, a six-story car park and a series of sky gardens.


Antani's "Antilla", one of the world's most expensive luxury homes in Mumbai, India Photo Credit: Reuters

2. Guo family (Kwok)
Net worth: $38 billion ($52.3 billion)
Location: Hong Kong
Company: Sun Hung Kai Properties
Launched in 1972, Sun Hung Kai Properties, founded by Guo Desheng, is one of the largest real estate developers in Hong Kong. Since his death in 1990, his three sons, Guo Bingxiang, Guo Bingjiang and Guo Bing, have taken over this huge family business.
In 1997, the Guo family's wealthy man in Hong Kong made the eldest son Guo Bingxiang stared at the criminals. At that time, he was driving home alone and he was kidnapped by Zhang Ziqiang, a criminal named "Big Rich". His family eventually paid HK$600 million (S$100 million) in ransom after about a week to redeem him. The former chairman of Sun Hung Kai Properties died of a stroke last year at the age of 68.
His second brother, Guo Bingjiang, was imprisoned for involvement in the corruption case and is currently serving his sentence.
Today, the third brother Guo Binglian is the chairman and general manager of Sun Hung Kai Real Estate.


Guo Binglian (left) and Guo Bingjiang (middle) Photo Credit: Reuters/ Dazhi Image

3. Xie family (Chearavanont)
Net worth: 37.9 billion US dollars (51.2 billion Singapore dollars)
Location: Thailand
Company: Charoen Pokphand Group
The Chia Tai Group is one of the world's largest producers of animal feed and livestock. The family business dates back to 1921, when Chia Ek Chor fled the village he was hit by a typhoon in southern China, and his brothers went to Thailand to start selling vegetable seeds from China to local farmers in Thailand. .
Today, nearly a century later, Chia Tai Group has become a key economic ally of Chinese President Xi Jinping.
Xie Yichu’s youngest son, Dhanin Chearavanont, served as Chairman and Chairman of the Chia Tai Group for 48 years. He retired in 2017 but he still retains the status of senior chairman. (Editor's note: Xie Guosheng resigned as a listed company of Zhengda Group on April 24, 2019, and is also the chairman of Zhengda Food Group, the most important business group.)
Today, the chairman of the Chia Tai Group is headed by Soopakij Chearavanont, the eldest son of Xie Guomin, and the youngest son, Suphachai Chearavanont, is the CEO of the group.


Xie Guomin, Senior Chairman of Chia Tai Group (中) Photo Credit: Central News Agency

4. The Huang family (Hartono)
Net worth: $32.5 billion ($44.7 billion)
Location: Indonesia
Company: Djarum, Bank Central Asia
Huang Huizhong and his brother Huang Huixiang inherited the cigarette manufacturer Pin Kee Group from his father Huang Weiyuan. After their father died, they invested their assets in Indonesia's largest private bank, the Indonesian Central Asian Bank. They are currently the largest shareholder of Indonesian Central Asian Bank.
Huang Huizhong’s son, Armand Wahyudi Hartono, has served as the deputy general manager of Central Asia Bank since 2016.
Added: Although Singaporean singer Nathan Hartono and the Huang family have the same "Hartono" surname, don't misunderstand, they have nothing to do with it.


Indonesian Regal Huang Huizhong Photo Credit: Reuters/ Dazhi Image

5. Lee family (Lee)
Net worth: $28.5 billion (S$39.2 billion)
Location: South Korea
Company: Samsung Group (Samsung)
Should you be familiar with the name of this group? Even if you haven't used his family's products, you should always hear it. If you don't have it, you are probably living in a cave.
In 1938, Samsung, founded by Lee Byung-chul, was originally a trading company that exported fruits and vegetables and fish. Later, he founded Samsung Electronics in 1969, which later became the world's largest manufacturer of memory chips and smart phones.
In 1987, the third child, Lee Kun-hee, took over Samsung Electronics after his father died. However, he was unable to work due to a heart attack in 2014. Since then, Samsung has continued to be led by his son, Lee Jae-yong.


Left is Li Zaiyu, right is Li Jianxi Photo Credit: Reuters/ Dazhi Image

6. Xu family (Yoovidhya)
Net worth: 24.5 billion US dollars (33.7 billion Singapore dollars)
Location: Thailand
Company: TCP Group
Red Bull, this energy drink brand believes that ant powder has been heard and even drunk? Not to mention that you may not know, just in 2018, 6.8 billion cans of Red Bull were sold! This energy drink, which is popular among people all over the world, was invented by the founder of the TCP Group, Chaleo Yoovidhya.
Back in 60 years ago, he first served as a drug salesman, and in 1956 he established the T.C. Pharmaceutical Limited Partnership and developed his own pharmaceutical formula.
After that, he looked at the business opportunities of the beverage and set about developing the energy drink formula, which is now known as the Kratingdaeng drink. Later, Mr. Xu Shubiao met the Austrian businessman, Dietrich Mateschitz, who was interested in introducing the "Red Bull" product into the European market. Therefore, he and Mr. Xu Shubiao jointly established “Red Bull GmbH” in Austria to export Red Bull beverages to 70 countries around the world.
In 2012, Xu Shubiao passed away, and the TCP group was taken over by his son, Saravoot Yoovidhya.


Chaleo Yoovidhya, founder of TCP Group Photo Credit: AP/达志影像

7. Misty family (Mistry)
Net worth: $21.1 billion (S$29 billion)
Location: India
Company: Shapoorji Pallonji Group
The family business of Misty originated from a construction transaction in 1865 by Pallonji Mistry and an Englishman. The architectural giant Shapoorji Pallonji Group, which has more than 150 years of history, was named Littlewood Pallonji&Co at the time. In 1881, the group built a reservoir on Malabar Hill in Mumbai to provide water to Mumbai residents.
His son Shapoorji worked in a family business after dropping out of school, and he continued to acquire a minority stake in Tata Sons. Tata Sons is the holding company behind the current $100 billion Tata Group.
Pallonji, the third-generation heir with the same name as his grandfather, joined the construction industry at the age of 18, and he later successfully signed many profitable contracts in his career. One of the most noteworthy cases is the Sultanate of Oman, which he established in Muscat. He handed over the company's leadership to his son Shapoor in 2012.


Shapoor's younger brother, Pallonji Mistry, took over as chairman of the Tata Group in 2012 and retired in 2016. Photo Credit:Newscom/ Dazhi Image

8. Shi Family (SY)
Net worth: 20.9 billion US dollars (28.7 billion Singapore dollars)
Location: Philippines
Company: SM Holdings Corporation
Shi Zhicheng was born in Xiamen, Fujian Province in 1924. At the age of 12, he went to the Philippines to join his father and worked in his father's grocery store.
Shijia’s grocery store was destroyed after the Second World War, but Shi Zhicheng did not choose to follow his father to return to China. After taking a degree in business at a university in Manila, he opened a shoe that sold American soldiers to the local area.
When his shoe store opened to the sixth, he decided to diversify his business and began to sell clothing and soft goods because the supplier could not increase the supply. Looking at the business opportunities, Shi Zhicheng brought the one-stop shopping concept to the Philippines. In 1972, he founded the first SM department store in the Philippines. In 1985, the first SM Super Mall with an area of 44,000 square meters (edited: 128,000 pings) was officially opened. To date, SM shopping malls have more than 70 in the Philippines, and SM Holdings has expanded its commercial segment to the hospitality, banking and real estate industries.
For the 11th consecutive year, the Philippine richest man has had six children. After he dismissed the chairman of the SM Holding Group two years ago, his business was handed over to his children and his right-hand man.
In January of this year, he died in his sleep and lived 94 years old.


Shi Zhicheng, founder of SM Holdings Group Photo Credit: Reuters/ Dazhi Image

9. Zheng family (Chirathivat)
Net worth: $20.3 billion (S$27.9 billion)
Location: Thailand
Company: Central Group
The Central Group, now the Thai retail king, originated from a grocery store more than 70 years ago.
Like many other family businesses in Thailand, the Zheng family is a Thai-born Chinese born in China. The founder, Tiang Chirathivat, moved from Hainan to Thailand in 1925 in order to make a living. He spent nearly 20 years in the father-in-law's restaurant to borrow money to open his own grocery store.
Unlike other Chinese immigrants who choose to open a shop in Chinatown, he opened the store on the outskirts of Bangkok. As he approached a large temple built by the royal family, he began to sell snacks and provide barge services to the public. Two years later, he moved to the other side of the river, and opened a new storefront near the Mandarin Oriental Hotel in Bangkok and the eldest son, Samrit. Nine years later, the Zheng family opened the first department store in Chinatown.
Today, the chairman of the Central Group, Tos Chirathivat, is the third generation of the Zheng family business. In 1993, he established Thailand's first super shopping center "Big C Supercenter", which met the needs of a large number of low- and middle-income people and achieved great success. After that, it expanded rapidly to 20 stores in three years.
Today, the Central Group has more than 50 subsidiaries and is one of the largest private business groups in Thailand. At the same time, the group also has a joint venture with China Jingdong specializing in e-commerce.


Tos Chirathivat, the third generation of the Zheng family business, Photo Credit: Reuters/ Dazhi Image

10. Kadoorie Family (Kadoorie)
Net worth: 18.5 billion US dollars (25.4 billion Singapore dollars)
Location: Hong Kong
Company: CLP Holdings
CATA Holdings, a subsidiary of Kadoorie, is Hong Kong's largest electricity producer, supplying electricity to 80% of Hong Kong's population.
During the 1880s, two brothers, Iraqi Jews, Elly Kadoorie and Ellis Kadoorie arrived in Hong Kong to work for the Shasson family (another prominent Jewish family). The two brothers later began to take root in Hong Kong and set up China Light and Power Co., Ltd. In 1903, the company's first power plant was officially put into service.
In addition, the Kadoorie brothers also began to enter the hotel industry. They entered the Hong Kong Shanghai Hotel Co., Ltd. in 1890, and its Peninsula Hotel brand manages many luxury hotels around the world.
Today, both groups are headed by Eli Kadoorie's grandson, Michael Kadoorie.


Michael Kadoorie (left) and Rolls-Royce CEO Ian Robertson (right) Photo Credit: AP/ Dazhi Image

11. Guo family (Kwek/Quek)
Net worth: $18.4 billion ($25.3 billion)
Location: Singapore / Malaysia
Company: Hong Leong Group Hong Leong Group
More than 15 members of the Guo family control the business of the Hong Leong Financial Group, which controls the real estate industry to the financial industry. The wealth of the Guo family can be traced back to 1941. The late Guo Fangfeng founded a small shop called “Huanglong” on the road of Meizhi with three brothers, specializing in the hardware business.
In the next few decades, he made a lot of investment in real estate by using the sensitive sense of the current situation. Finally, he saw the opportunity again in the late 1970s and decisively founded Hong Leong Financial Co., Ltd.
In 1995, Guo Fangfeng passed away. Guo Lingming, 54 years old, became the second generation of the Guo family. The Malaysian Hong Leong Group is the executive chairman of Guo Lingming’s cousin Guo Lingcan.


Guo Lingming, the second generation head of the Guo family, Photo Credit: AP/ Dazhi Image

12. Zheng family (Cheng)
Net worth: 18.2 billion US dollars (25 billion Singapore dollars)
Location: Hong Kong
Company: Chow Tai Fook
Chow Tai Fook, a jewellery brand that can be seen in major shopping malls, is run by the Zheng family. Perhaps you will be curious, why is Chow Tai Fook behind the family name Zheng instead of Zhou? In fact, the founder of Chow Tai Fook is indeed the surname Zhou, who is the father-in-law of Cheng Yu-tung, the founder of the Zheng family.
Zheng Yuqi was born in Shunde, Guangdong Province. At the age of 13, he escaped from the war. Under his father's arrangement, he went to Macau to rely on his father's good friend and Zhou Zhiyuan, who was working at Chow Tai Fook Gold Shop. Zheng Yuzhen’s good performance soon won Zhou Zhiyuan’s appreciation and gave his daughter Zhou Cuiying a license. Since then, he assisted his father-in-law to take care of the Gimpo business, and in 1946 he was appointed by his father-in-law to open a branch in Hong Kong.
In 1956, Cheng Yuxi inherited Zhou Dafu after his father-in-law died. During his administration, his first "999.9 pure gold" made Zhou Dafu famous. Later, he turned from gold to diamonds and brought his own brand of jewellery to the international market. In addition to the jewelry business, the group is also involved in businesses such as real estate and department stores.
In 2012, Zheng Yufu retired as chairman of the board in February 2012 and the company was taken over by son Zheng Jiachun.


Cheng Yufu, the former head of Chow Tai Fook Group (中) Photo Credit: Reuters/ Dazhi Image

13. Huang family (Ng)
Net worth: $17.2 billion (S$23.6 billion)
Location: Singapore
Company: Far East Organization
Huang Tingfang moved to China from China in 1934 and worked in his parents' soy sauce factory. Surprisingly, instead of continuing to carry out the family business, he set foot in the real estate industry and established the Far East organization in 1960.
The Far East Organization, together with its sister company, Sino Group, based in Hong Kong, is one of the largest real estate groups in Asia. The group has publicly traded, private development and investment companies with operations in Singapore, Malaysia, Australia, Hong Kong and China.
Today, the Far East organization is taken over by his two sons, Huang Zhixiang and Huang Zhida, who are the richest people in China. His eldest son, Huang Zhixiang, is responsible for the operation of Hong Kong, while the business of Singapore is managed by the younger son Huang Zhida.
In 2017, Huang Zhixiang's eldest son was appointed as the vice chairman of Sino Group, Tsim Sha Tsui Real Estate Group Co., Ltd. and Sino Group.


Huang Zhixiang, the chairman of Xinhe Real Estate Co., Ltd., participated in the land auction. Photo taken on May 8, 2007. Photo Credit:Reuters/ Dazhi Image

14. Bao Family (Pao)
Net worth: 16.7 billion US dollars (22.9 billion Singapore dollars)
Location: Hong Kong
Company: BW Group, Wheelock (BW Group, Wheelock)
Bao Yugang, known as the world's ship king, moved to China from China in 1949 and entered the shipping industry in 1955. At the age of 33, he bought the first ship with a Hong Kong dollar of HK$20 from Shanghai and opened his maritime business. Since the first ship he bought, after more than 20 years, the company has increased the number of its ships to more than 200.
In order to adapt to the economic situation, Bao Yugang will invest in the real estate from the profit from the shipping industry. A considerable part of the wealth of the Bao family is derived from the Hong Kong real estate developer Wheelock Group.
Bao Yugang’s business was distributed among his four daughters after his death.
In 2014, Bao Zonggang’s grandson Wu Zongquan officially took over the club’s Defeng Group.
15. Cai family (Tsai)
Net worth: 16.2 billion US dollars (22.3 billion Singapore dollars)
Location: Taiwan
Company: Cathay Financial, Fubon Financial
Cai Jiasan's brothers Cai Wanchun, Cai Wanlin and Cai Wancai founded Guotai Insurance in 1962, and later decided to separate in 1979. As a result, Cai Wanchun received the Cathay Trust, Cai Wanlin won the Cathay Insurance, and Cai Wancai obtained the insurance of Cathay.
Cai Wancai and his three sons together established Cathay Property Insurance, which has been renamed Fubon Financial Holdings, to become a large group of Taiwan's financial, telecommunications, media and other business segments.
After Cai Wancai passed away, Fubon Group continued to work together by Cai Mingzhong and Cai Mingxing. In 2016, the two brothers exchanged careers. Cai Mingzhong resigned as chairman of Fubon Financial Control and became the chairman of Taiwan's Big Brother.
